name: q17_2
probTex: Is there a sequence of polynomials which converge uniformly to the function $\frac{1}{z}$ on the annulus $1<|z|<2$?
solnTex:
No. Let $G$ be the annulus $1<|z|<2$. Suppose $f:G	o\mathbb{C}$ is analytic and $p_n	o f$ uniformly on $G$. Let $c$ be once around the circle $|z|= rac{3}{2}$. Because $p_n$ are entire functions for all $n$, by the Cauchy integral theorem
\[\int_cp_ndz=0.\]
Then, by uniform convergence,
\[\lim\int_cp_ndz=\int_c\lim p_ndz=\int_cfdz=0.\]
Thus $f(z)
eq rac{1}{z}$ because
\[\int_c rac{1}{z}dz=2\pi i
eq0.\]
